summary: This document contains two consecutive monthly credit card statements (December 22, 2018 - January 21, 2019 and January 22 - February 21, 2019) for a Bank of America BankAmericard account. It shows routine account activity including payments, interest charges, and standard terms and conditions. No named individuals are mentioned in the provided text. This is a Bank of America credit card account statement for the billing period February 22 to March 21, 2019. It shows a payment of $173.44 and interest charges of $2.68, with a new balance of $2.68. The document is a standard financial record with no direct mention of individuals or events related to the Epstein case.
locations: Bank of America P.O. Box 982234 El Paso TX 79998-2234

Payments were made to the account from a checking account (referenced as 'CHK') on 01/17/2019 ($100.00) and 02/14/2019 ($200.00).
The statement includes promotional material for 'Winter Village at Bryant Park', offering a discount for using the Bank of America card.
The document appears to be a financial record from the Epstein case files, but the account holder's name is not visible in the provided text.
